turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: God damn... Kid never had a chance...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Mothafuck... Hey!!! What the hell!!!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Hey... Cy... what now you a righteous Panther man, you too uppity to drink with us?

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: You know that's bullshit.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Aaaah, Bitter Motherfucker... I almost forgot how nasty that shit is.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well don't go forgetting your friends.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Ain't gonna happen, stay cool.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You know it. Stay Black...

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Damn straight.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Sabu, what the fuck you doing? Ain't nobody gonna push on this street.

turns.speaker: SABU
turns.text: Shit, I ain't doing nothing. White bread asks for cocaine, I take his money. Shit... you know... It was just a hustle.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Sabu... High white dude's the only thing you could hustle.

turns.speaker: SABU
turns.text: Man... fuck you. Why you always bustin' my balls? All that high and mighty militant shit. I ain't doing nothing.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: I ain't gonna tell you no more. No pushing in the neighborhood, especially not on my fucking street. You're killing your own people asshole.

turns.speaker: SABU
turns.text: Man, fuck you!!!

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: No Fuck you!!!

turns.speaker: SABU
turns.text: Motherfucker... you stay away...

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Look this is bull...

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Check it out... Great huh? I tell you those guys know what time it is. Man I'm with that...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I don't know. Look around man.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: C'mon Judge we got to start somewhere.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah, and I'm gonna start by getting on my feet. Working on things from inside the system.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Inside ain't in the system.  It's right there inside you!! I'm joining up.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Hey, this what they got you doing now?

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Party needs the bread.  Be hip to the struggle, only a dollar!!!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Have to pass on the revolution today man, I got class... But how about tonight, I was gonna check out "Cloud Nine." Just like old times.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Can't... they're having a PE meeting at Headquarters tonight, come on down. Check it out.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: PE? What? You guys doing gym class?

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: No man. PE -- "political education."

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: ...Glad you came man.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah, only I figure you'd be the one doing the speaking.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Not yet, one of these day's maybe. Bobby's party chairman. Political Education's really his bag.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Man, did you see Huey down on Grove street? All up on that cop, that was beautiful.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah, it was alright. Hey, can you give me a lift?

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: You got it. Berkeley?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: No, Panther Headquarters.  Least that way we could hang out more like we used to.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: You joining? My Brother..  My brother.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: Hey, it's the invisible man. Brother where you been?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Cy... I ain't even sure.

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: C'mon we'll walk and talk...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Naw... I gotta...

turns.speaker: CY
turns.text: I hear you. I'll catch you in a bit. Feeling cooped up in there, you know?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Cy... Cy... Oh shit man... who did this to you. Was it the pigs?

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: Don't I know it. Come on in Agent Rodgers. Sit down. Always a... pleasure to see you. How can I be of help?

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: It's a bit more like how can we help you. Bay Area's become quite a hornet's nest in terms of subversive activities. And... well Mr. Hoover wants to reiterate that the FBI will be happy to assist local authorities in any way we can. On a strictly advisory basis... of course.

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: Of course. Well, I appreciate your offer, but we got things pretty well under control. Same bunch of kooks you guys already have under surveillance. They're still doing a lot of yelling and pot-smoking but nothing to worry about.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: I see. What about the Black Panther Party for Self-Defense?

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: Heh, bunch of shines running around in dark caps waving their fists about some streetlight. They're loud, but they aren't dangerous,

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Can you make a deal with them?

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: Naw... They're kids mostly. Idealists. They actually think they're for real.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Hmmm. As you know the Bureau -- and Mr. Hoover -- is particularly "sensitive" to anything that might agitate or solidify the coloreds on the left.

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: You want me to put a man on it?

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: That would be an excellent start.  Tell him to keep a low profile.

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: One: "We want freedom. We want the power to determine the destiny of our Black Community." Two: "We want full employment for our people." Three: "We want to end the robbery by the white man of our Black Community." Christ, they're asking for reparations...

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: They couldn't have thought this up for themselves.

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: Now hold on Rodgers...

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Chief Dorsett, if the Black Panthers are going to remain in your jurisdiction, some fundamental changes in attitude need to be made...

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: I want it duly noted, that this operation was entirely under the auspices of the Oakland Police Department. The FBI doesn't have a monopoly on agents infiltrating enemy organizations, my friend. As I've said before, Agent Rodgers, we have things under control in our city...

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Are you finished?

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: No I'm not. I'd like to say, frankly and off the record, that I resent the Bureau's presence here. "Advisory Basis" or not. And, once we get these boys put away and the Panthers permanently discredited, I'd appreciate it if you'd leave us to take care of our own. Now I'm finished.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: These are memos from the commissioner, the mayor and Hoover himself, putting the Black Panthers and their subversive activities under the full jurisdiction of the Bureau.

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: As far as Mr. Hoover is concerned the worst has happened, the Panthers have unified with other organizations -- most likely sponsored by communists -- to undermine the war in Vietnam.  By doing so, they have quite simply guaranteed their own extinction.

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: Rodgers... this is no good...

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Cut the crap, you've been taking the man's money for years. Now it's time you earned it.

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: To be quite honest it turns my stomach.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Neither your stomach or your opinion matters here Dorsett... What matters is that Mr. Trafficante and the Bureau have come up with a solution to our Panther Problem. One might say...The Final Solution.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: I don't think that will be any problem...

turns.speaker: DORSETT
turns.text: You talk as if this thing's already been decided.

turns.speaker: ELDRIDGE
turns.text: But lots of our people don't read, man. They need strong imagery to help them out.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah... then shouldn't this be all of us together.

turns.speaker: ELDRIDGE
turns.text: Trust me Huey, this picture will be worth a thousand words. Now have you given any thought to that Peace and Freedom Party thing. They really want to hook up with us. Do a rally together. Hell it'd broaden our base of visibility.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah, but aligning with white organizations. I'm not sure now's the time.

turns.speaker: ELDRIDGE
turns.text: The time, my friend, is what Sartre called, "the moment the match is being put to the fuse." Question is, is the hand holding that match gonna be black or white.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: ...no full fledge alliance. But I think we should do a rally with them. Show that there's some common ground between Black and White. You all with that?  All right then Eldridge, set it up.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes sir I was.

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: And did you witness the shoot-out?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yes sir, I did.

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: From what you saw, did Huey Newton start the shooting?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: No sir he didn't.

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: Huh, well then...  did someone else start shooting?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I refuse to answer the question on the grounds it might incriminate me.

turns.speaker: GARRY
turns.text: Did you shoot the officers in question?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Again I'll take the fifth amendment on that question.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: ...at least that takes Bobby Seale off the street...

turns.speaker: HOOVER
turns.text: Not good enough Rodgers. Not good enough at all. Black terrorists on the floor of a State Capitol. I will not say this again, these Negro Commies are to be stopped and now. You tear them down. Either from the outside or the inside.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: We're working on that...

turns.speaker: HOOVER
turns.text: Work harder. And get me some results. Those Black Bastards could be up to anything.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Granted, the Free Huey thing has become a bit of a rallying cry for the left...

turns.speaker: HOOVER
turns.text: Rallying cry, it's an insurrection. Seale, that god damned Cleaver, Where the hell do these guys come from?

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: Well... like they say, there's a Panther born every minute in the ghetto. Uh... we seem to have "underestimated" the support of the Black community. It's their power base...

turns.speaker: HOOVER
turns.text: Well, then we're going to take that power away from those bastards.

turns.speaker: RODGERS
turns.text: You mean...

turns.speaker: HOOVER
turns.text: Yes, that's exactly what I mean. And Agent Rodgers?... This conversation never occurred.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: That's right brother... listen and learn.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: The white power structure wants us to act like savages.  But we're a different kind of animal altogether. We're Panthers. And The Black Panther Party for Self Defense is very painfully aware that America has historically reserved its most barbaric treatment for non-white people since the beginning of the country. So we need to organize, we  keep our shit correct! And effect revolution. We revolve the power into the hands of the people. Where it belongs.  Power to the people baby...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Shit, nothing but Paper Panthers.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah... but it seems they're bringing Malcolm's widow Betty Shabazz to town, to speak at a rally, do an interview for Ramparts.  And they want us to help with security.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: We'll get them. Right now we got to worry about being armed and ready to protect Betty Shabazz. Those phonies sure as hell can't. We need guns.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: We need money first...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah... Bobby you gotta...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: This here's a "Panther Patrol." We see a brother getting busted. We check it out, make sure the pig don't go beating on the man. Brother gets taken downtown, we post bail, hook 'em up with a lawyer.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: We're like policing the police.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You're a little old to be a school boy aren't you brother.  Cool it! You're probably not the only one they've gone after. Stall a little so they believe you're for real. Make them trust you.  Hey Tyrone, you figure feeding our children is gonna make The Man jumpy?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Black people getting uppity, feeding their children breakfast, taking their destiny into their own hands. What's this world coming to?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: C'mon let's...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: No! Just harassment. Can't let it stop this.  Brother we got momentum!

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Alright, I'll stay. Judge, I want to...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Where you been? I saw the cops rousting you at the rally.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Huey man I got to talk with you...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: So talk...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Alone...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Look... can we deal with this tomorrow... I'm tired...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Yeah man, but where's Judge?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You know I think Brother Judge needs our support right now, not our suspicion  This is beautiful man. Folks around here never read the truth like this before.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: That's right. We'd be proud to provide as escort for Malcolm's widow. How many men you got?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Get the brothers a beer. Me too while you're at it.  Men? Well we can spare six for security...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: No thank you sister.  Six?!! That seems a little light. Cops are watching Betty, watching her hard. We need at least twenty men. And that's twenty armed Panthers dig? You do have guns don't you?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I assure you that we as the revolutionary vanguard are as serious about this as you are. We'll be prepared.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: We put our lives on the line today. Malcolm X's widow was on the line today. And your guns weren't even loaded.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: A gun's a gun man. It don't need to be loaded.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Tell that to the pigs. Better yet tell that to Malcolm.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Wait a second there brother...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: No you wait a second. You and your "Panthers" got three choices. One you join with us and follow our rules. Two you change your name.  Or three you face annihilation.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You were. infantry right?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: So I guess it's safe to say you know about firepower.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: We appreciate your help with this.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: So what's the deal?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Freedom... We're just gonna test some of the words in that law book.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Judge... we're doing security for Betty Shabazz's visit next week. I'd like to have someone who knows there way around a pistol there. Someone like you.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You are down for protecting Malcolm's widow aren't you?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah... let me think about it.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Okay man I ain't going to push. But remember the revolution isn't going to wait for anyone. Come on, we'll give you a lift.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: No man. Gonna walk.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Welcome brother, have you decided to get down with us?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I'm down.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah... You were a lot of help with those guns. Your soldier shit is bad- ass.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I'd hoped I was finished with all that. But...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You know, you're lucky to be back. Most niggers die on the front lines. Seems like that's what they're there for.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Don't I know it. Every brother I knew in 'Nam's dead. My company... a land mine. Twenty of my friends dead in less than a second.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Mind if I ask you something? Why'd you put up with shit like that for someone else's war?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Hey, GI bill pays for school. And shit, if I stuck around here, instead of signing up, I'd probably be in jail, or sitting on the stoop drinking Bitter Dog with Rose, you know?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Yeah I know. You're smart Judge. You ain't no bourgeois nigger like those Paper Panthers across the bay. I need every good man to help us with the security on Betty Shabazz, particularly soldiers. You do solid on that I might have something else for you, something real important.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Whatever you need, I'll be there.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Right on Brother Judge...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What it be Judge. Nobody got hurt, Sister Betty's safe. This was a good day...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: They were empty...

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You were alright Judge, better than alright. You're what the Party needs. A fighter but also one that's going to school not making the man too nervous.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I don't know about that.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I do. You think you're smart enough to keep playing the game?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: What, I don't know how you mean?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: See, the thing about Panthers. For all their speed and strength. They are not naturally aggressive. They don't just go out killing, tearing through the jungles murdering. No, the Panther  keeps his claws hidden until he is attacked, until he's backed into a corner. Then  believe me those claws are fierce.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Huey, you're losing me. What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I'm talking about survival. Yours, mine, all of it. Outside and in. You got to do something for me. Staying alive might depend on it. The pigs are gonna try to infiltrate us and we're gonna let 'em. But their spy's gonna be our spy too. How about it?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Me? You've got a whole lot of other folks signing up. Why me?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You fit the profile, Brother. You look exactly like the kind of nigger they think they can trust...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Aw... uh... it's was just harassment. My driver's license expired.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Chickenshits, they're grabbing at anything.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What's the pig's name?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Brimmer.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You got to keep very cool on this. Icy god damn cool. Cause baby, you just became the strongest weapon we got. Let me guess, he wants you to call him, tell him what we're doing.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: And you're gonna do just that. But I'll tell you what to feed the pig. You alright with this?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah... I guess. Any of other Panthers know about this?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Man, this shit's pretty thick.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You got that right. And brother, I got a feeling it's going to get a whole lot thicker.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Listen Judge, Oakland's Panther International Headquarters. We shut the Pig's infiltration down here, they're gonna think twice about running their games on other chapters.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Huey, man who's gonna straighten out the brothers if they get on my ass?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Like the manual says, "Information is...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I don't know man. I don't know. That reminds me.  Another little donation from the police.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: If the pigs only knew they were subsidizing The Panthers...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah well, they want a lot for their money. They want a felony, preferably with "violent intent." We've got to give them something. They'll kill me if I don't. And the Panthers are going to kill me if I do. I'm scared.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Me too. That's why I fight so hard.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I saw... but...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: But nothing... you do live here don't you?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah, I do.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Well, act like it. Come on.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Don't let the cops provoke you. We're there to watch and take badge numbers...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: And who is we?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Shit, we made him get his moms to give permission before he could sign up.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Just a kid.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Yeah, well, cops kick the shit out of kids too.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I thought you said all the Panthers were gonna be here.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: What you see is what you got.  That's' Bobby Seale.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: You're a smart brother... you should dig what Huey and Bobby got to say...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Maybe...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Fuck maybe... be there.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Busted firing pin.  You want only the legal stuff right?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Just the legit shit.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: He had a feeling you'd be coming by.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: What? You don't like to see a traitor get hurt? I wonder why that is?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: If you got something to say, say it.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Anything happens to Huey it ain't gonna be a finger. I'll...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: What's up with you?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: You got something on your mind... "brother."

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah, "brother" My best friend is stone dead.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Sorry man...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: S'alright. I'm sorry too. Shit, I gotta take a leak... Pull over at that gas station.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Fuck is up?!

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Mothafucker! You just set Bobby Seale up to be kidnapped. They dragged him off to some bullshit conspiracy trial in Chicago. How much the pigs pay you for this one, Judge?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: You better just kill me Tyrone. And when Huey gets out, when Oakland's just wall to wall junkies, you tell him you blew away the only chance we all got. I'm sure he'll be real happy about that.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: The pigs are gonna start flooding us with dope. Huey wants us to stop them.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Bullshit...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Chickenshits? What you bring your buddies with you?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: No man No!! Tyrone listen... we got to move man, they got a warehouse...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Shut the fuck up!!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: You alright?

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Not really. Gimme the keys for the trunk.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Motherfuckers...

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Look... You... take her and get the hell out of here. I'll keep 'em busy.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: We'll all get out of here together.

turns.speaker: TYRONE
turns.text: Later for that. I'm done either way...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You supposed to be a wounded vet, Motherfucka. What you do in 'Nam anyway, shoot gooks or shoot hoops?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: All of the above, man...  And then some.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: My Mom's at that.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Funny you don't look like church folk to me.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Rose, what the hell you doing here?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Just come for the food, man. Ain't quite sure what their bag is but...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: This cool the heat off you any?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I don't know.  But I'm sure I'll find out. Rose, you did me solid.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Unh... Unh Man... I don't take no money from friends that need help. Fuck no. What do you think I am a bum?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Not at all.  I'll catch you later.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Judge... I... I shoulda told you this before but... well... fuck...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It was Sabu killed Cy.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Where is he?.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Ain't no one seen him.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Didn't want folks to think I was a snitch. You know?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Rose?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah... Look man, what I gotta say. It's just you, me and the rats, right? Alright... well... Sabu's back.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Motherfuck... well then I got something to do.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No... wait, there's something else, something weird. I hear he's set up down at that warehouse on fifty deuce. He's talking big and living bigger.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: God damn it's him. I gotta go.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Judge man. Watch yourself. Sabu's got juice now.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: You don't even know it man, but you're a god damn hero.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: It's okay Mom. I'm allright.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: You don't look alright.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah... cop hit me...

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I saw. I saw that big one  hit that police man. Saw 'em drag you off too.  They take you to jail?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Lord, never thought I'd live to see my boy in prison.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Mom! It wasn't like that. It was bullsh... They were just harassing us. No charges were filed. It's alright.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: You meet those friends of yours in jail too?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Yes... No... Mom it's not like you think. They're alright. There out there trying to do something.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I hear them boys, those Black Panthers, they're communists. They don't even believe in God.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Mom, black folks been praying to God for four hundred years. Maybe it's time we tried something else...

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: You believe that?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I don't know. I really don't.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I'm sorry we didn't give you more warning.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: It's alright.  I'm very happy for you.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Do you think Frances with an "e" is too manly a name for a girl?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Do you think Francis with an "i" is too womanly a name for a boy?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Late summer.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I know who you are, Gabriel Marion. The last time I saw you, I was nine and you put ink in my tea.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I... uh... that wasn't me, it was Samuel... I mean Nathan...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: It was you and it turned my teeth black for a month.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: If I'd known you were going to look like this, I never would have put ink in your tea.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You call that a compliment?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: It's a start.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Next time we'll bring more blankets.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: That would be nice.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Maybe we'll be lucky this winter and have just rain, no snow.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: That would be nice, too.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: You expect to hold Cornwallis with militia?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I expect to try.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Trust you and Harry Lee.  Remember that damned overland you two thought up in '62 to hit Fort Louis?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: It worked.  How many men can you raise?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Not many.  Dalton, Scott, they've got their reasons; Rev. Oliver, he believes in the cause; some of the young bucks; a few like me with nothing to lose...  What about you?  You've got a lot to lose.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: I say we drink the wine, shoot the dogs, and use the papers for musket wadding.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: His journals, letters, maps, books...

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Am I one of that sort?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You're the worst of that sort. You're the sort that gives that sort a bad name.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I've just been inside the mind of a genius.  Lord Cornwallis knows more about war than I could in a dozen lifetimes.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Cheerful news to greet the morn.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: His victories at Charleston and Camden were perfect, strategically, tactically, logistically.  But he has a weakness.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Personally, I'd prefer stupidity.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Pride will do.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: He reminds me of you before you got old and ugly.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: No, he takes after his mother...

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: What do you mean, old and ugly?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: You got me beat on both accounts.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: The hell I do.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: He shouldn't make light.  That Redcoat should not have been killed.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: He's not making light.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: You don't know him very well, do you?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: He's my father.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I know him well enough?

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: Don't fault him for having grown up on the frontier.  It was a harder time and a harder place than you know.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: You got salt last week.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Oh, right.  Baking powder, we need baking powder.

turns.speaker: BILLINGS
turns.text: We've got plenty of baking powder. You went to Pembroke and got five pounds two weeks ago.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: They're from good stock on their mother's side.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You look well, Charlotte.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: As do you.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: And send us to war alongside Massachusetts.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Our governor is a bigger fool than I thought.
